newsitem.title: USA: K.C. Fed manufacturing index falls to 6 in July.
newsitem.headline: K.C. Fed manufacturing index falls to 6 in July.

text.p: The Federal Reserve Bank of Kansas said its quarterly manufacturing survey showed area factory sector conditions were showing expansion in most areas during July but at a slower pace than in April.
The survey, which the Kansas City Fed began publishing last fall, takes a snapshot of manufacturing during the first month of each quarter by asking plant managers about a variety of indicators.
The diffusion index was calculated by subtracting the percentage of total respondents reporting decreases in a given indicator from the percentage of those reporting increases.
Index values greater than zero generally suggest expansion, while values less than zero indicate contraction.
The closer index values are to 100, the more widespread are increases among respondents. The closer it is to -100, the more widespread are decreases.
The July survey included 198 responses from plants in the Tenth Federal Reserve District's seven states.
